intro: Malvastrum copelandii, commonly known as the Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with a soft, velvety texture. Malvastrum copelandii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
